content: For the Valueset-event-status there is a note in the definition of "entered-in-error" that indicates "If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be 'cancelled' rather than 'entered-in-error'" but there isn't a status of "cancelled" in the value set. I tried using 'cancelled' but it fails validation. Does that mean the status needs to be "entered-in-error" even if real-world activity did occur? Or should the status be "aborted?" Reference: http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/valueset-event-status.html
It should be 'aborted'. Can you submit a change request?
